Tennessee Scholarships


100 Club Scholarship (General I)
1. To be eligible applicants must be a present or retired Memphis or Shelby county Law Enforcement officer or Fire Department personnel or immediate family member.
Immediate family members of deceased law enforcement or fire department personnel are also eligible.
2. Immediate family members are defined as the law enforcement employee or firefighter, their spouse and children, both natural and adopted. Non-adopted stepchildren
will be eligible if they are under the age of 18 and reside in the same household as an eligible law enforcement employee or firefighter. Children over the age of 18
must reside in the same household as an eligible law enforcement officer or firefighter.
3. Law enforcement employee or firefighter must have 10 year service record if retired, or five years if still employed. Whether retired or not, there must be a minimum of
5 years service as a ‘first responder’ or equivalent capacity in the case of law enforcement where the law enforcement officer is an employee involved in the active
response to calls for law enforcement assistance, and in the case of firefighters, five years service as firefighter, EMT, or paramedic in a non administrative capacity.
The service periods must be years of full-time, commissioned service in a potentially life-threatening situation as part of your regular duties. Criteria must be verified by
HR office and have their official seal.
4. Sheriff’s Department deputy jailers and correction officers who meet the service time requirements criteria may be eligible.
5. No law enforcement officer or firefighter (including immediate family members) is eligible if officer or firefighter was terminated for misconduct or resigned because of
misconduct.
6. Recipients must be a high school graduate or a high school junior or senior on course to graduation at time of application.
7. Must maintain a 2.5 GPA to remain eligible for scholarship to be renewed for second semester.
8. Matching dollar amount given by the University of Memphis.
Requires Law Enforcement Officer or firefighter name, Law Enforcement Officer or firefighter address and telephone number, Requires Certification by Human
Resources Office of law enforcement/fire-fighter status indicated above.
Note: Non-renewable scholarship more...

2018 Wilma "Skeeter Scholar" Rudolph Scholarship
In honor of Wilma Rudolph, the Wilma “Skeeter” Rudolph Scholarship is awarded to two collegiate African-American females who will be participating in athletics during college. This scholarship is to assist in the retention of African American female students as well as aid them in completing their academic careers
Open to an incoming freshman, African-American female student-athlete planning to attend Austin Peay State University or Tennessee State University.
Residing in Montgomery County, Tennessee, or Fort Campbell, Kentucky.
*Must be a senior graduating in 2022 from a Clarksville-Montgomery County High School, Fort Campbell High School, or Clarksville Private High School.
*Minimum 2.75 cumulative Grade Point Average
*Must be present at the Scholars Reception program held in early May 2022, in Clarksville, Tennessee more...

2019-2020 Thurgood Marshall American Airlines Hbcu Completion Scholarship
Students will receive a scholarship of up to $2,250 to be used to cover outstanding costs for seniors confirmed to graduate in December 2019.
• Enrolled full-time in an accredited TMCF member-school
• Confirmed graduating senior in December 2019
• Current cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher
• U.S. citizen or permanent legal resident with a valid permanent resident card
• Demonstrated outstanding financial need more...

The AK Henderson Scholarship is award to a Graduate Level student seeking a Masters of Public Service degree. Must have a 3.7 or above grade point average. Student must be full-time. more...

A. Max & Susan S. Souby Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Vanderbilt University who are enrolled in the School of Engineering and are majoring in Chemical Engineering. Selection is based on academic merit. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

A.J. Cavert Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Vanderbilt University who are enrolled in the Peabody College of Education and Human Development. Awards are based on need, academic achievement and potential. Preference given to graduates of Hume-Fogg High School (TN). Student must complete a financial aid application, a FAFSA, and the Financial Aid PROFILE. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Nonrenewable; but recipients may reapply and compete annually. more...

Student must complete a financial aid application, a FAFSA, and the Financial Aid PROFILE. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Nonrenewable; but recipients may reapply and compete annually. more...

Abe Waldauer (General I)
1. Resident of Shelby County.
2. Demonstrate and maintain an exceptional academic achievement (an A or B average).
3. Recipients may be eligible in subsequent years provided they continue to meet the aforementioned criteria. more...

Abell Family Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen or transfer students accepted to Vanderbilt University enrolling in the College of Arts and Science. Awards are based on need, high school/college record, and standardized test scores. Preference given to applicants from Monroe/Ouachita Parish, Louisiana, then northeastern Louisiana, then Louisiana. Student must complete a financial aid application, a FAFSA, and the Financial Aid PROFILE. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Students who qualify must reapply annually. more...

Absolutely Ax Endowed Scholarship
The Absolutely AX Scholarship is awarded to a full-time undergraduate student with a minimum GPA of 2.8 and a demonstrated financial need. more...

Academic Scholarship - Milligan College
The Academic Scholarship is open to incoming freshman and transfer students at Milligan College. Freshmen are selected based on their GPA and ACT/ SAT scores, while transfers are selected based on their previous college GPA. more...

Academic Work
The Academic Work Scholarship is a tuition and fees scholarship. Applicants must be a State of Tennessee high school graduate with a 2.9 High School GPA un-weighted and 19 ACT or 900 SAT (Verbal and Math); and no prior college attendance. Students must work 75 service hours per semester for continuing eligibility. more...

Academic Work Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Tennessee State University. Students must be graduates of a Tennessee high school, have a minimum 2.9 GPA, a minimum 19 ACT score or a minimum 900 SAT score, and have completed a minimum of 14 Tennessee Board of Regents high school units. Applicants must work a minimum of 75 hours per semester and keep a minimum 2.9 GPA. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Access And Diversity Grant
The Access and Diversity Grant is awarded to students who meet one of the following requirements: FAFSA expected contribution of $4000 or less; or pursuing a degree in a STEM discipline such as engineering, math, biology, nursing, etc. more...

Accountancy Enrichment Fund Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending the University of Memphis who are majoring in Accounting. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and completed ACCT 2010. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. more...

Ackermann Scholarship
The Ackermann Scholarship is available to full - time students at Pellissippi State Community College. You must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. more...

Acs Local Section Scholarship
The ACS Local Section Scholarship is available to rising seniors majoring in chemistry at the University of Tennessee, Chattanooga. You must demonstrated academic performance and service to the department to be eligible for this award. more...

Acs-Hach Land Grant Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to a full-time undergraduate student with a declared major in chemistry and a commitment to become a high school chemistry teacher. The recipient must have and maintain a 3.0 grade point average; must be a U.S. citizen or a lawful permanent resident of the US; preference for students with a demonstrated financial need. The student must agree to submit a brief annual written statement to the donor describing their career status for the first five years following graduation. more...

Student must complete a financial aid application, a FAFSA, and the Financial Aid PROFILE. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Students who qualify must reapply annually. more...

Adma Hammam Shibley Memorial Scholarship In Library Science

First consideration is given to students planning a career in the field of library science; second consideration is given to stuents enrolled in the College or the Liberal Arts. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Administrative Council Scholarship
The Administrative Council Scholarship is available to students attending Pellissippi State Community College. You must have completed a minimum of 30 credit hours at PSCC, have at least a 2.5 GPA and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. A letter of recommendation is required. more...

Adolph Ochs Journalism Scholarship
Scholarship for first-time freshmen enrolling at the University of Tennessee-Chattanooga. Applicants must have a minimum 3.5 GPA and a minimum ACT score of 26 or SAT score of 1170. Preference given to Communications majors. Number of awards and award amounts may vary. Renewable. more...

Adult Scholarship (Student Academic Success)
The Adult Scholarship Program is designed to help adult students reach their educational goal of receiving their first Bachelors Degree. This highly competitive, scholarship is $5,500 per year for full-time students/$2,750 per year for part-time students and is awarded annually to a limited number of students. Students should apply for admission and be accepted as a degree seeking undergraduate student by March 12th.
Selection Criteria
1. In-state and out-of-state undergraduate students are eligible.
2. Must be pursuing first undergraduate degree to be eligible.
3. Students must reach their 25th birthday by August 1st of application year.
4. Current students must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA and new students must meet Adult Admission requirements to be considered for selection.
5. Part-time students must complete a minimum of 6 hours and full-time students must complete a minimum of 12 hours per semester.
6. Preference given to students who do not already have a scholarship.
Renewal Requirements
1. Renewable for up to eight full time or equivalent part-time semesters (dependent upon class level at the time the scholarship is awarded)
2. Minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0.
3. Completion of Service hours:
Full-time recipients
Complete 20 hours of community service
Log 6 Student Leadership & Professional Competency Experiences via TigerZone
Participate as an active member of the Adult Student Association, or comparable Registered Student Organization
Part-time recipients*
Complete 10 hours of community service
Log 3 Student Leadership & Professional Competency Experiences via TigerZone
Participate as an active member of the Adult Student Association, or comparable Registered Student Organization
All service hours must be approved through the Adult and Commuter Student Services Office. Contact the ASA at 678-3593 for details.
4. Actively participate in the Adult Scholarship Mentoring Program during your first year on the scholarship.
Note: Some recipients may be eligible for only one semester. more...

Adult Student Support Scholarship
The Adult Student Support Scholarship is available to students at Pellissippi State Community College. You must be 24 years of age or older and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. more...

Allen J Hammond Memorial Scholarship (Student Academic Success)
1. Recipient shall be an incoming freshman with a high school GPA of 3.0 or community college graduate with college GPA of 2.8.
2. Recipient shall be resident of Shelby County, TN.
3. Shall have a proven track record of service in school, community and/or church.
4. Consideration shall be given to students with financial need.
5. Preference may be given to African-American students.
6. Recipient must maintain 2.5 GPA and satisfactory progress toward completion of a degree in order to retain the scholarship.
An incoming freshman recipient may retain scholarship for a maximum of 8 semesters. A community college transfer recipient may retain the scholarship for a maximum of 4 semesters. more...

Alpha Theta Network Continuing Student Legacy Scholarship
The Continuing Student Legacy Scholarship is awarded to a student who is a child or grandchild of an ATN Legacy member (father/grandfather must be in good standing with Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc. being financial and active on all three levels – i.e. Grand, Province, Local); have a cumulative GPA of 3.0; and must become an active member of the Pre-Alumni Council. more...

Alpha Theta Network First Time Student Legacy Scholarship
The First Time Legacy Scholarship is awarded to a child or grandchild of the Alpha Theta Network Legacy member (father/grandfather in good standing with Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc. financial and active on all three levels-i.e. Grand, Province, Local- and in good standing with the ATN and the TSUNAA); have scored a 21 on the ACT or 980 on the SAT; have a high school GPA of 3.0 and be a new first time student. more...

Alpha Theta Network Undergraduate Endowed Scholarship
The Alpha Theta Network Scholarship is awarded to students who are active members of the Alpha Theta Chapter of Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc., who have a minimum cumulative gpa of 2.5. The applicants must be active members of the Pre-Alumni Council and be in good standing with the University. more...

Alphonso Sherman Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Tennessee State University. Students must demonstrate financial need and academic achievement. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Alumni (Alumni Association)
The scholarship shall be available to any first time, incoming freshman who has a parent or grand-parent (family member) who is a dues-paying member of the University of Memphis Alumni Association. The deadline for the family to have joined the Alumni Association as a dues-paying member shall be anytime during the calendar year prior to the student’s application for the scholarship. Scholarship is renewable without application, contingent upon student maintaining a 2.5 cumulative gpa for first two semesters and 3.0 each subsequent semester, making satisfactory progress towards a degree at the University of Memphis, and maintaining full-time status. Student must be enrolled in Fall immediately following high school graduation. Selection committee shall consider scholarship and leadership in making its selection. Recipients who apply for financial aid will have the amount of the award considered when calculating the total amount of aid student is eligible for. more...

Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Tennessee State University. Students must demonstrate academic achievement. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Anna Caroline Menkel Scholarship (General)
1. Preference shall be given to students of Hispanic origin to the extent allowed by law.
2. Recipient shall be enrolled as a full-time freshman undergraduate at the University of Memphis.
3. Recipient must qualify for and have been awarded the TN HOPE Lottery scholarship. The Anna Menkel Scholarship shall serve as a
supplemental scholarship to the TN HOPE Lottery Scholarship.
4. Renewable as long as the student remains on the TN HOPE Lottery Scholarship. If student fails to qualify for the TN HOPE Lottery
Scholarship, eligibility for the Menkel Scholarship will cease. more...

Anne Wagner Scholarship

Preference is given to a student who is enrolled at an off-campus site with preference given to Cookeville. Student should have completed a minimum of six semester hours and must be degree seeking with a declared major. A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 is required. more...

Balanced Man Scholarship
The Ancient Greeks believed in developing a Sound Mind and a Sound Body as the way to live a fulfilling life. The men of SigEp at University of Memphis share this belief and chase this ideal by striving to become Balanced Men.
The Balanced Man Scholarship at University of Memphis is open to all incoming male students. This scholarship is awarded to applicants who excel in the four pillars of the Balanced Man Ideal; Leader, Scholar, Athlete, and Gentleman.
This scholarship is a way for SigEp at University of Memphis to give back to those who share the same aspirations as its brothers. This scholarship gives top incoming freshman the chance to acclimate to University of Memphis and possibly be awarded for their achievements. more...

Beverly Hope Presley Scholarship (College Of Education)

3. The purpose is to ease the financial burden often associated with the demands of student teaching.

Beverly J. Gilliam Scholarship For Foreign Study 2020
The Beverly J. Gilliam Scholarship for Foreign Study offers financial assistance to students who are accepted into recognized summer study abroad programs. The scholarship’s goals are to help students obtain international experiences that will allow them to become better world citizens and successfully compete in the global job market. Beverly J. Gilliam was educated in the New York Public School System received her undergraduate degree from City University of New York and obtained a graduate degree from Columbia University School of Library Science.
Her professional career started in Asia where she was responsible for activating and managing American libraries in Korea and Japan as well as libraries at U.S. military installations throughout Europe. Her overseas experience impacted her career and allowed her to become well-versed in various cultures. This program will allow UNCF students to experience diverse cultures and participate within challenging overseas’ academic environments. more...

Bit Charles And Edna Neumann Scholars Program (Fogelman College Of Business And Economics)
The BIT Charles and Edna Neumann Scholars Program offers FCBE students that are considering BIT/MIS as their major (or as a minor) an opportunity to learn about the BIT/Management Information Systems (MIS) profession and the diverse career opportunities that exist in the field before applying for advanced standing.
The benefits of participating in the BIT Charles and Edna Nuemann Scholars Program include:
?? Invitations to social gatherings with BIT faculty and distinguished FCBE guests, such as the BIT Advisory Board meetings
?? Membership to Association of Management Information Systems (AMIS) student organization
?? Participation in real-world IT experiences of the Technology Careers in Business (TCB) program
?? Invitations to networking with business professionals, faculty, and students, such as attending meetings of the Association for
Management Information Systems (AMIS) student organization
?? Opportunities to apply for BIT/MIS-related internships
?? Access to the people and activities that will let students build a stronger professional resume
Program Requirements:
Students will be required to participate in at least two BIT Neumann Scholar activities each semester to maintain status as a BIT Neumann Scholar, thus students will need to:
1. Attend at least one BIT Advisory Board meeting
2. Attend at least one AMIS Meeting
Recipients shall be enrolled at the University of Memphis and shall be selected in accordance with the following process and criteria:
1. The student must be registered and in good academic standing during the term the award is received.
2. Preference will be given for applicants who are: Non-traditional student status, 1st in family, 1st generation, and/or single parents.
3. Provide Faculty recommendation.
4. Provide a one-page reflection paper about how technology has influenced the person’s life for the better.
5. Selection is competitive and will be based on the information submitted on the BIT Charles and Edna Neumann Scholars Program
Application form in Tiger Scholarship Manager. more...

Botany Scholarship (College Of Arts And Sciences)
To be eligible to apply for any of the Department of Biological Sciences scholarships, students must have successfully completed General Biology I and II. In addition all students must be enrolled
full-time with a declared major in the Department of Biological Sciences during the semesters in which they hold any of these scholarships.
Applicants must meet the following requirements:
- Major in Biology, with preference given to a student with interests in Botany
Applicants must provide:
- A completed application with essay
- Two recommendations from faculty in the Department of Biological Sciences or another science department at the University of Memphis or at another college or university, in the case of a transfer
student. One letter may be from an employer for students who have science-related work experience.
- Undergraduate transcript more...

Clark Family Engineering Excellence Scholarship Fund (Herff College Of Engineering)
The recipients shall be enrolled full-time at the Herff College of Engineering at the University of Memphis.
The recipients are charged with:
1. Getting involved with student events, join clubs, and make new friends.
2. Balance studies, work, and fellowship.
3. Attend all class periods, prepare for each class, and pay close attention to your professors.
Recipients shall be selected in accordance with the following process and criteria:
1. Incoming freshmen must have a minimum ACT composite score of 25 or SAT equivalent and a minimum GPA of 3.2.
2. Continuous progress towards degree completion and a minimum cumulative 2.75 GPA must be maintained to be eligible for renewal.
Scholarship may be renewed annually for a maximum of 4 consecutive years or 8 consecutive semesters. more...

1. Students must also submit 2 letters of recommendation.
2. Demonstrate good moral character.
3. Have a minimum cum. GPA of 3.25.
4. Recipients must be citizens of the US (or have a green card.
5. Preference given to students who are involved in their communities.

Commercial Advisors Partners Finish Line Scholarship (Fogelman College Of Business And Economics)
Recipients shall be enrolled at the University of Memphis and shall be selected in accordance with the following criteria:
The Commercial Advisors Partners Finish Line Scholarship is intended to help FCBE students who need financial resources to complete their degree. These students are typically in their final semester(s), have exhausted other sources of funding, have financial need, and generally do not qualify for other merit-based funding. The criteria are intended to remain as flexible as possible so as not to prevent a deserving student from receiving these funds, but provided some guidance regarding the intended recipients. The overall mission for this fund is to help these students finish their degree and be productive citizens after graduation, with a preference given to those students intending to reside in Memphis after graduation. A committee appointed by the Dean of the FCBE will select the recipients. The selection process shall be coordinated through the University’s Scholarship Office. more...

Confucius China Studies Program - Joint Research Ph.D. Fellowship
In order to foster deep understanding of China and the Chinese culture among young generations from around the world, enable the prosperous growth of China studies, promote the sustainable development of Confucius Institutes, and enhance the friendly relationship between China and the people of other countries, the Confucius Institute Headquarters has set up the ??Confucius China Studies Program???.
1. Purpose – Support doctoral students (candidates) registered with foreign universities to come to China for study, research and writing of their doctoral dissertations.
2. Duration – From six months to two years.
3. Eligibility
?? Non-Chinese citizen;
?? HSK test score level 3 is required, and priority is given to applicants with higher level of proficiency in Chinese under same conditions;
?? Applicants who are currently participating in Chinese Government Scholarship are not eligible to apply for this Program.
4. Application materials
?? Ph.D. Study Certificate;
?? Two letters of recommendation from scholars in related field;
?? HSK transcript;
?? Abstract of master’s thesis or other academic publications;
?? Abstract of doctoral dissertation;
?? A research plan for the study in China;
?? Priority is given to applicants who obtain a letter of recommendation from local Confucius Institutes.
5. How to apply – The applicant shall submit the online application, and then post the application form and other supporting documents to the Confucius Institute Headquarters.
6. Assessment Process – The Confucius China Studies Program Expert Committee will review the application materials and conduct video interview.
7. Funding
?? Lodging and living stipend: 80,000 RMB per year
?? Research fund: 20,000 RMB per year
??Round-trip international airfare
?? Tuition;
?? Other support provided by the host Chinese university
?? Expenses for the foreign supervisor??s visit or research in China
?? Expenses for life and medical insurances in China
???? Group activities and cultural experience
For additional information, please contact the Confucius Institute at 901.678.4597 or via email: dye1@memphis.edu. Feel free to visit us as well at The University of Memphis, Wilder Tower 11th Floor. more...

Confucius China Studies Program - Ph.D. In China Fellowship
In order to foster deep understanding of China and the Chinese culture among young generations from around the world, enable the prosperous growth of China studies, promote the sustainable development of Confucius Institutes, and enhance the friendly relationship between China and the people of other countries, the Confucius Institute Headquarters has set up the ??Confucius China Studies Program???.
1. Purpose -Support foreign students to pursue full-time Ph.D. degrees in the humanities and social sciences at Chinese universities.
2. Eligibility
?? Non-Chinese citizen;
?? HSK test score level 5 is required, and priority is given to applicants with higher level of proficiency in Chinese under same conditions;
?? Applicants who are currently participating in Chinese Government Scholarship are not eligible to apply for this Plan;
3. Application materials
?? Recognized transcripts of undergraduate and graduate studies, diplomas and copies of all the documents above in Chinese;
?? HSK transcript;
?? Abstract of master??s thesis and other academic publications;
?? A doctoral research statement;
?? Two letters of recommendation from scholars in related field;
???? Priority is given to applicants who obtain a letter of recommendation from Confucius Institutes.
4. How to apply – Applicants shall submit the online application at ccsp.chinese.cn, and then post the application forms and other supporting documents to the Confucius Institute Headquarters.
5. Assessment Process – The Confucius China Studies Program Expert Committee will review the application materials and conduct video interview.
6. Funding
?? Lodging and living stipend: 80,000 RMB per year
?? Research fund: 20,000 RMB per year
?? Round-trip international airfare
?? Tuition
?? Other support provided by the host Chinese university
?? Expenses for life and medical insurances in China
?? Group activities and cultural experience more...

Confucius Institute Scholarship
For the purpose of supporting the development of Confucius Institutes, facilitating international promotion of Chinese language and dissemination of Chinese culture, as well as cultivating qualified Chinese-language teachers and excellent Chinese-language learners, Confucius Institute Headquarters/Hanban launches a Confucius Institute Scholarship program to sponsor foreign students, scholars and Chinese language teachers to study Chinese in relevant universities of China.
(1) Scholarship Coverage
a) Tuition
b) Accommodation fees on campus
c) Monthly living allowance (except Four-Weeks-Scholarship students)
d) CNY 2,500 for Bachelor??s Degree Students ,One-Academic-Year Students and One-Semester Students, CNY 3,000 for Master??s Degree Students
a) Insurance for foreign students studying in China
(2) Requirements of applying for CI Scholarship
a) Non-Chinese citizens
b) Aged between 16 and 35 (Chinese language teachers in post shall be aged below 45, and applicants for BTCSOL scholarship
should be aged below 20)
(3) Requirements of HSK and HSKK scores
a) Provide official report of HSK,HSKK test
(4) Application Procedure
a) Between March and June of each year, applicants shall go to the CI Scholarship website at http://cis.chinese.cn, apply for CIS id,
fill in the application form, and attach with some documents of proof
b) Confucius Institutes/Independent Classrooms, or Embassies (Consulate-General) of China, or China host institutes shall log on the website at http://cic.chinese.cn, take the applications and make recommendations based on performance of the applicants
c) Eligibility of applicants are reviewed by the host institutes, and nominations are submitted to the Headquarters
d) Eligibility of applicants are reviewed by the host institutes, and nominations are submitted to the Headquarters
e) CI Headquarters will organize an expert panel to make the final selection, and the applicants can check the results on
cis.chinese.cn at the end of June
(5) Other Documentation
a) Photocopy of the passport (the page with holder????s photo)
b) Teachers of Chinese should provide proof of years of teaching and weekly teaching hours issued by organizations in which they
work
c) Official report of HSK, HSKK test
d) Notarized photocopy of highest diploma and official transcripts. Notarized photocopy of highest diploma is required for both one-
year academic program applicants and M.A. TCSOL program applicants. M.A. TCSOL program applicants shall also provide
official transcripts
e) Letter of Recommendation. M.A. TCSOL program applicants should submit letters of recommendation (both in Chinese and
English) from two associate professors
f) Applicants under the age of 18 should submit the legal documents of their legal guardians in China
g) Written Commitment. M.A. TCSOL program applicants must sign a commitment promising to fulfill a five-year Chinese teaching
service after graduation
h) Proof of prize-winners and CI Scholarship Certificate from organizer of Chinese Bridge Chinese Proficiency Competition for
college and middle school students
For additional information, please contact the Confucius Institute at 901.678.4597 or via email: dye1@memphis.edu. Feel free to visit us as well at The University of Memphis, Wilder Tower 11th Floor. more...

1. Has declared Accounting as a major and is enrolled in 12 credit hours min.
2. maintains a 3.0 or higher cumulative GPA.
3. has reached JR or SR classification.
4. special consideration will be given to the prior year’s recipient provided that the student continues to meet or exceed criteria a-c. more...

Contribute To The Challenge Radiology Program Scholarship
The Contribute to the Challenge Radiology Scholarship is funded by Dr. David Heflin and Carla Jaeger. It is established as a need-based scholarship for radiology students. Each year there will be two scholarships awarded – one for a first year student and one for a second year student. Monies can be used for additional expenses associated with the program such as books, uniforms, and testing fees. more...

Cory Darnell Scholarship

Cox Family Memorial Scholarship Fund (College Of Education)
It is the donors intent that this scholarship benefit students with financial need, and that individual awards be sufficient to allow recipients to focus on their studies without the concern of financial burdens or debt. This award(s) shall be given to undergraduate student(s) who meet(s) these qualifications:
A. Recipient(s) must be a junior or senior enrolled full-time and fully admitted to the undergraduate program with no less than a 3.25 GPA.
B. Recipients must have graduated from a high school located in the state of Tennessee.
C. Preference shall be given to applicants:
I. Applicants who intend to pursue a career facilitating the educational development of individuals with learning challenges. First preference shall be given to applicants pursuing dual licensure in Special Education and Elementary Education, or subsequent successor programs that prepare students to educate individuals with special needs. Second preference shall be given to applicants who demonstrate a desire to work in an inclusive classroom as a co-teacher or similar, comparable position.
II. Applicants who demonstrated financial need as determined by a review of the student’s completed FAFSA form or successive similar form.
III. Applicants who receive and retain the TN HOPE Lottery Scholarship or successive similar award. This award may be applied toward tuition and fees not covered by the HOPE scholarship and/or other aid.
D. Awards are not automatically renewable; recipients must reapply each year to be considered.
Award recipients, the number of awards, and the amount of each award shall be determined by a committee appointed by the Dean of the College of Education, Health and Human Sciences. The selection process shall be coordinated through the University’s Scholarship Office. more...

Dean Richard R Ranta Bandmasters Championship Senior Class Award (Alumni Association)
Recipient shall be enrolled at the University of Memphis and shall be selected based on the following:
1. Applicant must be a high school senior in the fall of the year in which application is made.
2. Applicant’s high school band must participate in the Bandmasters Championship in same year.
3. Applicant must demonstrate intent to march in the University of Memphis Marching Band in the fall of the following year.
4. Once named a finalist, applicant must schedule an audition for the University of Memphis Marching Band.
Award is contingent upon recipient’s acceptance in the University of Memphis Marching Band.
If recipient does not meet all requirements, another will be selected from the group of finalists. Consideration will be given to financial need. more...

Donald K Carson Leadership Scholarship (Student Academic Success)
Friends of Dr. Donald K. Carson, retired Vice President for Student Affairs at the University of Memphis, have established a scholarship in his name. The scholarship seeks to recognize student leaders who affirm intrinsic worth in people and challenge people to become more than they have been. Applicants must demonstrate a strong capacity for leadership and be able to show how their leadership helps create opportunities for the growth and development of other people.
1. Recipients shall be enrolled at the University of Memphis
2. Shall complete and submit an application to the Carson Scholarship Committee, or be nominated for this scholarship by a member of the University of Memphis faculty or staff.
3. Shall be full-time undergraduate students and shall have successfully completed a minimum of twelve (12) credit hours at the University of Memphis, but no more than 60 credit hours.
4. Shall achieve and maintain a minimum cumulative GPA of at least 2.8.
Priority review and consideration will be given to candidates who are not currently receiving a leadership based scholarship. more...

Dr. Bobby G. Greer Endowed Graduate Fellowship In Rehabilitation Counseling (College Of Education)
This fellowship shall be given to one or more graduate students in the Rehabilitation Counseling program with these qualifications:
A. Recipient must be enrolled full-time and fully admitted to the graduate program with no stipulated requirements.
B. Recipient must maintain no less than a 3.25 GPA.
C. Preference may be given to applicants enrolled in the Rehabilitation Counseling program who intend to pursue a career facilitating the personal, educational and vocational development of individuals with emotional, cognitive, physical and/or neurological impairments.
D. Financial need may be a consideration but is not a necessary condition for receipt of this fellowship. If there is a demonstrated financial need, it has to be determined after reviewing the student’s completed FAFSA form.
E. Recipient must reapply to be considered for the award in subsequent years.
Award recipients, the number of awards, and the amount of each award shall be determined by a committee appointed by the Dean of the College of Education, Health and Human Sciences. The selection process shall be coordinated through the University’s Scholarship Office. more...

Dr. Elizabeth L. Dalton-Kappa Delta Pi Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending the University of Tennessee-Chattanooga who are majoring in Education with an emphasis in teaching. Selection based on academic merit and potential. Due date, number of awards and award amounts may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Dr. Gabrial P. Racz Leadership Fellowship
Scholarship for full-time graduate students attending the University of Memphis who are majoring in Accounting. Students must have a minimum 3.25 GPA, and exhibit leadership. Applicant may be a graduate assistant. Due date and number of awards may vary. Contact the College of Business and Economics for more information and/or application. more...

The Dr Halden W Hooper, Sr Endowment Scholarship is given to a full-time or part-time student with promise. A 2.5 minimum cumulative GPA is required to maintain the scholarship. more...

The recipient of this scholarship
1. shall be enrolled in the School of Communication Sciences and Disorders
2. Pursuing a M.A. degree in Speech-Language Pathology
3. The scholarship recipient will be determined by a selection committee appointed by the Dean of the School of Communication Sciences and Disorders
4. Good academic standing
5. Demonstrated financial need, and
6. A minimum 3.0 grade point average
7. Special consideration will be given to students who are members of under-represented groups more...

Dr. J. Owsley Manier Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen or transfer students accepted to Vanderbilt University. Awards are based on need, high school/college record, and standardized test scores. Preference given to residents of Giles County, Tennessee and then to the residents from other Middle Tennessee counties. Student must complete a financial aid application, a FAFSA, and the Financial Aid PROFILE. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Students who qualify must reapply annually. more...

Dr. Lillian H. Chaney Business Scholarship (Fogelman College Of Business And Economics)
A maximum of one scholarship will be awarded in any fiscal year.
The amount of the annual scholarship will be $5,000.
Scholarship recipient selection criteria are as follows:
A. Applicant should be a full-time junior or senior undergraduate student in the Fogelman College of Business & Economics with a
minimum grade point average of 3.0.
B. Relatives of faculty and staff employed by the University of Memphis are ineligible.
C. Preference will be given to students with demonstrated financial need as determined after review of the student’s completed Free
Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form. more...

Dr. Littleton H. Mason Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending the University of Tennessee-Chattanooga. Selection based on academic merit, financial need and potential. Preference given to minority students from low income families from Memphis. Due date, number of awards and award amounts may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Dr. M. David Rudd Scholarship For U.S. Military Veterans (Student Academic Success - General)
1. Scholarship awards shall be used to recruit and retain U.S. military veterans enrolled at the University of Memphis who have either exhausted or will exhaust their VA awarded GI Bill entitlement by Spring 2022 or Summer 2022.
2. The recipients of this scholarship must meet the following criteria:
a. Be undergraduate, degree-seeking veterans who have obtained senior status
b. Be in good academic standing
c. Demonstrate financial need after review of the student’s completed Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form or any future similar form that replaces
the FAFSA.
3. Submit a 250 word essay showing how this scholarship will enable them to complete their degree requirements for graduation. more...

3. Pref shall be given to high-ability students with a demonstrated financial need.
4. Each scholarship shall be awarded for 1 academic year. Recipients may reapply provided they maintain a min cum gpa of 2.75 and participate in 15 service hours each semester for the Physics Dept. more...

Dr. Tom Miller Memorial Scholarship

Dr. Miller was a much-loved professor at Volunteer State Community College and taught in the Math and Science division. The scholarship is for full or part—time students studying in the field of science. more...

Dr. Tze S. Wu Scholarship For Excellence In Civil Engineering (College Of Engineering)
1. This award(s) shall be given to one or more full-time undergraduate and/or graduate students majoring in Civil Engineering at the Herff College of Engineering at the University of Memphis.
2. Preference shall be given to students with an academic focus in Structural Engineering.
3. In order for an undergraduate student to be eligible, he/she must be classified as a junior or senior and have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.2 and be making continuous progress towards degree completion.
4. The scholarship may be renewed annually and may be awarded for a maximum total of 2 consecutive years for each individual recipient. more...

Dr. Valencia B. Price
The Dr. Valencia B. Price Scholarship is awarded to an in-state incoming freshman with a minimum gpa of 3.0 gpa. The scholarship is for $5,000 a year. The scholarship is renewable if the student maintains a 3.0 gpa each semester. more...

Dr. Virginia M Norton And Dan Norton Scholarship (College Of Arts And Sciences)
To be eligible to apply for any of the Department of Biological Sciences scholarships, students must have successfully completed General Biology I and II. In addition all students must be enrolled full-time with a declared major in the Department of Biological Sciences during the semesters in which they hold any of these scholarships.
Applicants must meet the following requirements:
- Major in Biology, with an expressed interest in a career in Health Science
- Junior or Senior classification
Applicants must provide:
- A completed application with essay
- Two recommendations from faculty in the Department of Biological Sciences or another science department at the University of Memphis or at another college or university, in the case of a transfer
student. One letter may be from an employer for students who have science-related work experience.
- Undergraduate transcript more...

Educate A Woman Scholarship

Education That Works Scholars Program
The recipients of this scholarship shall be enrolled at the University of Memphis and shall be selected in accordance with the following process and criteria:
1. Students must have the Tennessee HOPE Scholarship and retain the scholarship.
2. First preference will be given to students who attended one of the Jubilee Catholic Schools in Memphis, TN and are a graduate of Memphis Catholic High School.
3. Preference will be given to students with financial need as demonstrated by documentation to be determined by the University of Memphis.
4. Preference will be given to first generation students.
5. Preference will be given to students who have demonstrated service and leadership in a written personal statement.
6. Preference will be given to students majoring in disciplines within the Fogelman College of Business and Economics or the College of Education, Health, and Human Sciences.
Scholarship recipients must:
1. Live on campus during their freshmen and sophomore years. Students may live off campus during their junior and senior years with a stipend provided for expenses. Stipend amounts for residence halls, meal plans, and off-campus housing will be determined each year by the selection committee. Scholarship recipients will be notified of these amounts in advance of choosing housing and meal plan options.
2. Participate in one of the leadership programs at the University of Memphis.
3. Respond to inquiries by the Directors of Development in the College of Education, Health and Human Sciences and the Fogelman College of Business and Economics regarding academic status and the participation in leadership programs required to maintain scholarship eligibility. Scholars are required to participate in mentoring sessions organized by the Directors of Development which will be held as requested by the donor. more...

Edward B Orio Memorial Scholarship (Student Academic Success)
Award shall be given to a student who is an active member in good standing of Lambda Chi Alpha Fraternity, Zeta Theta Chapter, at the University of Memphis who:
A. demonstrates financial need (by qualifying for a Pell Grant at any level)
B. Full-Time student in good academic standing
Note: Current recipients shall be eligible to reapply and have the award renewed, as long as they are active members of Lambda Chi Alpha, Zeta Theta Chapter and continue to meet all other criteria. more...

2. majoring in computer engineering or electrical engineering.

4. To be eligible for renewal, the recipient must be making continuous progress toward a degree in electrical engineering or computer
engineering and
5. have a GPA of 3.0 for the first year and
6. a GPA of 3.25 for subsequent years. more...

Elizabeth & Harold Robinson Education Scholarship (College Of Education)
1. Can be undergraduate or graduate student.
2. Majoring in Education with an intent to teach.
3. Shall be F/T.
4. Preference may be given to students from the rural Mid-South.
5. Financial need may be considered.
6. Minimum ACT 24 and must maintain 3.0 GPA to retain the award. Graduate students must be admitted to the Graduate School and must maintain a min GPA of 3.25 to retain the fellowship. more...

Elizabeth & Harold Robinson Scholarship (College Of Communication And Fine Arts)
1. Can be undergraduate or graduate student
2. Majoring in CFA
3. Shall be Full-Time
4. Incoming freshmen must have a minimum ACT score of 24
5. Current Undergraduate students must have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.30 and must maintain a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 in order to retain the award for a maximum of four (4) years
6. Graduate students must be admitted to graduate school before applying for the fellowship and must maintain a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.25 to retain the award for a maximum of three (3) years
7. Submit a resume
8. Submit one letter of recommendation more...

2. Junior or Senior.

Elizabeth K. Perryman Scholarship (College Of Arts And Sciences)
Award shall be given to:
1. Student with full-time status (min 12 credit hrs)
2. An undergraduate majoring in Biology, with preference given to a student with interest in cell and molecular biology, microbiology or health sciences
3. Sophomore, Junior or Senior classification
4. Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0
5. Must have demonstrated valuable service to the community or university, preferably for women’s equity
6. Preference may be given to an applicant who is first-generation university educated or has a disadvantaged background
7. Applicants must provide a completed application with essay
8. Applicants must provide two recommendations letters from faculty in the Department of Biological Sciences or another science department at the University of Memphis or at another college or
university, in the case of a transfer student. One letter may be from an employer for students who have science-related work experience.
9. Applicants must provide their undergraduate transcripts. more...

Emerging Leaders Scholarship (Student Academic Success)
The Emerging Leaders Scholarship is awarded to in-state and out-of-state first-year students who demonstrate an interest in leadership development and qualify for eligibility according to our requirements. It is available to first time students and renewable for up to 4 years for students attending the main University of Memphis campus. Applicants must have applied and been accepted to the University of Memphis. Eligible Students must have a 3.0 GPA (on a 4.0 scale.)
After the initial application process, an interview process will be conducted before the final Emerging Leader cohort is chosen. The interview process will take place on-campus in mid-February during business hours. Students who are chosen for the interview process will receive further details via email. In the event that a student cannot travel to the University, there will be a virtual interview opportunity.
Note: The scholarship cannot be combined with University wide academic scholarships, including Dean, Provost or Presidential scholarships.
Renewable Criteria
1. Renewable with maintenance of 3.00 cumulative GPA.
2. Renewable each semester with the completion of all paperwork and other program responsibilities, including workshops, campus and community involvement, professional development activities, academic coursework, and speaker and program specific meeting attendance, as outlined and communicated by program staff each fall and spring semester.
3. Recipient must enroll as a full-time student during the fall and spring semester, completing at least 12 credit hours per semester and 24 hours annually. No scholarship will be available during summer classes.
4. Selected applicants must attend New Student Orientation (separate from student athlete orientation), Frosh Camp, and a retreat for incoming Emerging Leaders in the summer before their first semester. All dates will be communicated at the time of selection.
5. Students must live in the Emerging Leaders Learning Community during the first year of the program and must remain enrolled at the main University of Memphis campus during all semesters the scholarship is awarded. Housing costs are the responsibility of the student and not included within the $5,500 scholarship amount. more...

Emerson And Annie Able Endowed Scholarship
The Emerson and Annie Able Endowed Scholarship is awarded to a student who is a graduate of a Tennessee public high school, alternating among cities, whose GPA is equal to or greater than 3.25, preferably education and music majors. more...

Scholarship for graduates of Tennessee public high schools; gpa of 3.25 or higher;preferably education and music majors. more...

Emmaryne H. Geny Honor Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Montgomery County, Tennessee who are incoming freshmen accepted to Vanderbilt University. Selection is based on academic merit, leadership, ACT/SAT scores, an essay, and recommendations. Students need only to complete the admissions application to be considered for this award. Number of awards may vary. Award amount usually is for partial tuition, but may cover up to full-tuition. Renewable. more...

Engineering Scholarship
We are proud to offer an engineering scholarship worth $5,000 to entering freshman, current students, and recent graduates. We are a Mechanical, Electrical, Plumbing, Sprinkler, and Fire Protection Engineering Firm based in New York. To become NY Achievers, students should be Ambitious and self-driven as evidenced by outstanding achievement in school, community or work-related activities. You can find the detailed information on Engineering Scholarship’s. To enable your students to apply simply add a link on your website to our Engineering Scholarship’s page. Submissions from students attending a university without a link to our Scholarship page won’t be considered. more...

Engineering Success Scholarship
1. Enrolled as a full-time student in the Herff College of Engineering college
2. 26 ACT Math or equivalent
3. 3.5 High School GPA
4. Evidence of Financial Need (Pell Eligibility, unmet financial need from FAFSA, etc)
Awards will be $3,000/year (maximum 4 years) and will be awarded on a competitive basis. more...

Engineers' Club Proutt Memorial Scholarship (College Of Engineering)
1. Scholarship applicants must submit two letters: one being a personal/character reference that confirms good moral character, and the other letter being an academic/professional reference.
2. Scholarship recipients must be permanent residents of Shelby County, Tennessee, graduates of a high school within Shelby County, and enrolled in the Herff College of Engineering.
3. Recipients must have and maintain full time status and good academic standing.
4. Annually, scholarship recipients will be expected to attend at least one meeting of the Engineers’ Club and make a brief statement. more...

Scholarship for freshmen and transfer students accepted to Vanderbilt University. Preference given to students from Shelby and Williamson counties, Tennessee. Awards are based on need, high school/college record, and standardized test scores. Student must complete a financial aid application, a FAFSA, and the Financial Aid PROFILE. Awards are based on need, academic achievement and potential. Student must complete a financial aid application, a FAFSA, and the Financial Aid PROFILE. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Equal Chance For Education Opportunity Scholarship (General)
Each year, millions of students graduate from American high schools. Counted among that throng of proud graduates are about 10,000 students who have graduated from Tennessee high schools who are not eligible for in-state tuition, federal aid or student loans because of their residency status. Unlike for their classmates, however, this moment of achievement is muted by the fact that their path to higher education remains difficult at best.
The University of Memphis is committed to ensuring that anyone who is determined and demonstrates the skills and motivation needed to earn a college degree has access to higher education. We are pleased to partner with Equal Chance for Education, a non-profit organization based in Nashville, TN that provides scholarships to students based on academic excellence, financial need and interview evaluation and without regard to race, religion, or nation of birth.
Recipients must be graduates of Shelby County Schools. Must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and are/or will be involved in a leadership and/or service initiative. Must be eligible for the Non-resident tuition program and shall not be eligible to receive federal or state financial aid. Recipients must be enrolled at the University of Memphis main campus.
Please note: The Equal Chance for Education Opportunity Scholarship does not cover room and board more...

Eric Melkent Scholarship (College Of Communication And Fine Arts)
The recipients of this scholarship shall be enrolled at the University of Memphis and shall be selected in accordance with the following process and criteria:
1. Be in good standing and enrolled full time with a minimum GPA of 2.5.
2. Recipients shall be majoring in Art with a concentration in Graphic Design.
3. Recipients shall be selected based on talent.
4. The scholarship is renewable.
5. This scholarship requires a portfolio submission in order to be complete. The portfolio is due February1st. No portfolios received after February1st will be accepted. The ideal portfolio will be in the form of a single pdf document. If you are using Power point it does contain an option to convert files into pdf format. more...

Fedex Purple Runway Aviation Scholarship (College Of Professional & Liberal Studies)
This is a non-renewable, $10,000 scholarship per student for the Academic Year. The scholarship committee will select the best-qualified candidates from a highly competitive pool of applicants. Successful scholarship candidates are:
1. Selected on the basis of academic achievement
2. Personal strengths
3. Leadership
4. Financial need
To be considered for the scholarship, it is recommended that applicants meet the following eligibility requirements:
1. Must hold a FAA Private Pilot’s license, or greater
2. Written personal recommendation from a current University faculty member
3. Emphasis on underrepresented students (i.e., goal is for 20% of the scholarships to target women/minorities)
4. Minimum GPA 2.5
5. Be a US citizen or permanent resident/resident alien
6. Financial need
7. Community service, extra-curricular activities may also be considered
8. Candidates will be selected by the aviation faculty at the University of Memphis more...

Ferris Hooshmand Scholarship Award (Fogelman College Of Business And Economics)
1. Recipients shall be enrolled at UOM and maintain 3.0 min. in first year of program.
2. Must demonstrate a positive attitude and enthusiasm for life-long learning.
3. Must demonstrate overcoming adversity at some point in their lives.
4. Nominees must have completed one year in the UOM EMBA Program.
5. Students can either be nominated by their classmates, faculty, or they can nominate themselves. Nominated students must complete a Hooshmand Scholarship Application, which will be available in the spring semester of each academic year. Applications will be available in the EMBA Programs Office. No student can receive the award more than once. more...

Freshmen Engineering Scholarship Application (College Of Engineering)
When financial barriers prevent a talented individual from expanding or completing his or her education, it is a loss for society. At the U of M, we measure our success in the differences we make in students’ lives. Many scholarships are available, but to be considered, first you have to apply to the U of M. To apply for an engineering scholarship, visit engr.memphis.edu/scholarships.
Awarded separately through the U of M and through Herff.
Freshman scholarships are 100% merit based.
$3,000 per year for 4 years ACT composite score of 30 and a 3.5 GPA
$5,000 per year for 4 years ACT composite score of 32, math ACT of 32 and a 3.5 GPA more...

G Douglas Edwards Family Endowed Scholarship Agreement (Fogelman College Of Business And Economics)
Recipients shall be enrolled at the University of Memphis in FCBE.
1. First time students and previously enrolled students are eligible.
2. Freshman shall have min. cum ACT of 27.
3. Sophomores, Juniors & Seniors must have a min. cum. gpa 3.0.
4. Recipients shall maintain a 3.0 min. cum. gpa each sem. to continue on scholarship.
5. Recipients must be enrolled in a min. of 12 credit hrs. ea. sem.
6. Financial need may, but does not have to be a consideration in reviewing candidates. more...

G Douglas Mayo And Mildred H Mayo Heritage Room Endowment (General)
Preference shall be given to graduate students whose majors fall under the Department of History of Museum Studies, or University College students who are pursuing a degree which includes either of these concentrations.
Candidates shall demonstrate a special interest in the history of the University of Memphis.
For Graduate Assistantships, recipients shall participate in a learning environment within the University of Memphis Heritage Room for 10-20 hrs/wk as assigned by the Curator of Special Collections. Assignments may include working in the Heritage Room to ensure that it is open on an appropriate schedule.
Recipients are eligible to reapply. more...

1. To support students in the Herff College of Engineering who
2. Have demonstrated the ability to be successful in college and
3. Are making progress toward a degree but need additional financial resources to complete their degree
4. To be eligible for this scholarship, a student must be within 45 hours of graduation,

6. Be registered as a full-time student and

Goldye L Feinstone Endowment (College Of Arts And Sciences)
To be eligible to apply for any of the Department of Biological Sciences scholarships, students must have successfully completed General Biology I and II. In addition all students must be enrolled full-time with a declared major in the Department of Biological Sciences during the semesters in which they hold any of these scholarships.
Applicants must meet the following requirements:
- Major in Biology, with preference given to a student with interest in microbiology or molecular cell sciences
- Sophomore, Junior, or Senior classification or a doctoral student
- Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.25 or demonstrated potential for academic distinction in Biology
- Academic and research achievements as well as potential for professional success
- Full-time status (12 credit hours for undergraduate students)
Applicants must provide:
- A completed application with essay
- Two recommendations from faculty in the Department of Biological Sciences or another science department at the University of Memphis or at another college or university, in the case of a transfer student. One letter may be from an employer for students who have science-related work experience.
- college transcript more...

Herff College Of Engineering Merit Scholarship Fund (Herff College Of Engineering)
Recipients shall be enrolled at the Herff College of Engineering at the University of Memphis and shall be selected in accordance with the following process and criteria:
1. Incoming freshmen must have a min ACT composite score of 30 or SAT equivalent and a min GPA of 3.5. Continuous progress towards degree completion and a min cum 3.2 GPA must be maintained to be eligible for renewal. Scholarship may be renewed for a max of 4 consecutive years or 8 consecutive semesters.
2. Incoming transfer students must have successfully completed all necessary math, science and English composition courses required for the engineering degree they are pursuing OR must have completed an approved articulation program. A min cum GPA of 3.5 is required for consideration. Recipients must maintain a min cum GPA of 3.0 and show continued progress towards degree completion to be eligible for renewal. Scholarship may be renewed for a max of 4 consecutive semesters (2 years) for a F/T student and a max of 6 consecutive semesters (3 years) for a P/T student. P/T students must be enrolled in 6 credits per semesters. more...

Herff Engineering Doctoral Fellowship
Scholarship for doctoral students attending the University of Memphis who are majoring in an Engineering field where the research emphasis is in an area related to Biomedical Engineering. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable.. Contact the College of Engineering for more information and/or application. more...

Herff Engineering Fellowship
Scholarship for graduate students attending the University of Memphis who are majoring in Engineering. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. Contact the College of Engineering for more information and/or application. more...

Heritage Farms Scholarship
The Heritage Farms Scholarship is available to junior and senior students at Middle Tennessee State University. You must be majoring in agriculture and demonstrate academic excellence in the area of milk processing to be eligible for this award. more...

6. Scholarship may be renewed for the recipient’s senior year if satisfactory academic progress is made. more...

Herschel W. Nation Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for first-time freshmen enrolling at the University of Tennessee-Chattanooga who will be majoring in English or Communications. Applicants must have a minimum 3.5 GPA and a minimum ACT score of 26 or SAT score of 1170. Number of awards and award amounts may vary. Renewable. more...

Higdon Textbook Awards
Scholarship for current undergraduate students attending the University of Tennessee-Chattanooga who are majoring in Chemistry. Selection based on a minimum 3.0 GPA, financial need and contributions to the department. Due date, number of awards and award amounts may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Hino Motors Manufacturing Engineering Scholarship (Herff College Of Engineering)
Recipients will be students enrolled in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Quality Engineering, or Industrial Engineering
who have maintained an overall 3.0 grade point average during their Freshman and Sophomore years and
are in good standing with the University.
The first year (2016-2017), one Junior and one Senior recipient will be selected; thereafter, one Junior recipient will be selected.
Junior recipients may continue to receive the scholarship for their senior year provided they continue to meet the criteria as stated above and funding is available.
The scholarship award will be $4,500 per semester for a maximum of four semesters, assuming the recipients maintain a 3.0 grade point average and remain enrolled in one of the majors listed above and funding is available.
Additionally, a six-week paid internship will be offered in the summer between the Junior and Senior years.
Upon graduation, the recipients may be offered a 90-day paid internship. At Hino’s discretion, the students may then be hired, offered an extended internship, or be released. If the student is hired as a full-time Hino Employee, he/she may be reimbursed by Hino for tuition costs for their Freshman and Sophomore years ($4500 × 4 semesters – $18,000). Reimbursement will be contingent upon the student executing a three-year service agreement with Hino and will be paid by Hino in three equal installments not to exceed $6,000 payable at 12, 24 and 36 months of employment. more...

Award selection criteria are as follows :
1. Students must show leadership and involvement on campus and within the Hispanic community
2. The student must have a 2.5 GPA more...

Hospital Corporation Of America Scholars Scholarship
The Hospital Corporation of America Scholars Scholarship is awarded to five (5) Tennessee State University first-time freshman students planning to major in Health Care Administration, Health Information Technology, Public Health, or Health Science in the College of Health Sciences. When combined with the Tennessee Hope Scholarship the HCS Scholars program provides full funding for on-campus (in state) tuition and fees, on-campus housing and dining, a stipend for textbooks and supplies, and a laptop computer. (a package value ~$18,000)
To be considered, high school seniors must apply for admission to Tennessee State University. An essay (1,000-word minimum) on why you are pursuing a career in Health Care Administration, Health Information Technology, Public Health, or Health Science and what you hope to accomplish in your career is required. Students must have a HS GPA of 3.25 or above; ACT Score of 23 or above or a SAT of 1130 or above. more...

Ihg Current Expendable Scholarship (Wilson School)
1. Recipients shall be currently enrolled as full-time students at the University of Memphis (UM) with a declared major in Hospitality and Tourism within the Kemmons Wilson School of Hospitality and Resort Management (KWH).
2. Be in good academic standing with a minimum 2.5 GPA and
3. Satisfactory completion of no less than 12 credit hours in the academic major.
4. Complete the online U of M scholarship application, using Tiger Scholarship Manager software as directed, and providing all required documentation for consideration and including the following:
a) A letter from the student stating why they are deserving of the scholarship, why they are interested in a career in hospitality/tourism, describing their work experience and career plans.
b) A letter or recommendation from a Professor / Instructor or a current employer.
The recipients must agree to:
a) Maintain high ethical standards which embody the values of the SCH, IHG, and the KWS.
b) Share certain personal and academic information with SCH / IHG for marketing and media purposes (newsletters, annual reports,
etc.), to include: recent high resolution digital photo and certain personal information including current U of M status (year of study)
and hometown.
c) Complete the development form and provide a letter of appreciation addressed and submitted to the donors via the annual report.
Special consideration will be given for students who have overcome obstacles such as socioeconomic or educational disadvantages. more...

The fund shall be used to provide two scholarships to students who meet the following criteria:
1. One rising undergraduate junior and one rising undergraduate senior.
2. Majoring in Marketing.
3. Min cum GPA 3.25 and enrolled in 12 credits or more.
Special consideration will be given to a candidate who contributes to the diversity that is crucial to the advertising industry and the educational outcomes within the Marketing Dept. Diversity shall be defined based upon the anticipated make-up of each rising junior and senior marketing class as well as the advertising industry.
Special consideration will be given first to the prior year’s recipient provided that the student continues to meet or exceed stipulations a-c. more...

Israel And Alisa Kamin Memorial Scholarship (College Of Education)
The first award shall be given to a student pursuing a degree within the Herff College of Engineering. The schlp shall be renewed annually until the recipient completes his/her degree or becomes ineligible at which time the award shall be given to a student pursuing a degree within the College of Education and will likewise be renewable until the recipient completes his/her degree or becomes ineligible. in subsequent years, the award shall alternate between the two colleges until the endowment balance reaches the amount of at least $60,000 at which time an award will be made in both colleges each year.
1. Recipient shall be entering freshman, full-time undergraduate pursuing degree in Engineering or Education, whichever is appropriate during the current academic year with a cumulative high school GPA of 3.2.
2. Sophomores, Juniors & Seniors must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0. more...

Law Enforcement Memorial Scholarship
The Law Enforcement Memorial Scholarship was established in memory of all Sumner County law enforcement who have lost their lives in the line of duty. The endowed scholarship is based upon need and primary consideration for the award will be given to children or spouses of officers killed in the line of duty. In the event that there are no eligible applicants in this category, the second consideration will be for the children of active full-time enforcement officers. If neither of these two conditions exists, the recipient will be chosen from active full-time officers who desire to complete or continue their education. more...

You must be a student council president, Beta Club and/or Honor Society President, state officer in any students organization, or JROTC Battalion Commander. You must also have a minimum 3.0 GPA and a minimum 20 ACT score. more...

Lisa Huffstetler Memorial Scholarship In Political Science (College Of Arts And Sciences)
The recipients of this scholarship shall be enrolled at the University of Memphis and shall be selected in accordance with the following process and criteria:
1. Full-time undergraduate students majoring in Political Science classified as rising sophomores, juniors or seniors
2. A personal statement from the student, sharing their accomplishments, hardships, interest in the field of Political Science or other relevant information
3. A preference for students who were emancipated minors or adopted in their teen years
4. A preference for need
5. 2.5 minimum GPA, but students who have less than a 3.0 GPA should describe, in their personal statement, the circumstances which may have affected GPA more...

Little Family Scholarship
The Little Family Scholarship is funded by Beth and Len Little as an annual, need-based scholarship for full-time students at Volunteer State Community College who reside in Sumner County. Students who are or have been in foster care will receive preference. The recipient of this scholarship is encouraged to use any excess funds to purchase a computer. Also, the recipient is discouraged from utilizing student loans to remain debt-free. more...

Scholarship for undergraduate students attending the University of Tennessee-Chattanooga who are veterans, enrolled in the ROTC program or students with strong patriotism. Selection based on academic merit, financial need and potential. Due date, number of awards and award amounts may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

1. Full-time underrepresented students at the University of Memphis.
2. Transfer students are eligible for the award if they meet all other criteria.
3. Undergraduate applicants must possess a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.0
4. Graduate students must possess a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5 on the 4.0 scale
5. Applicants must submit one letter of recommendation from an advisor or University of Memphis faculty or staff member
6. Applicants must provide a personal statement as to why you are applying for this scholarship. Include any pertinent information about academic aspirations, financial need, or
any other special information we should consider. more...

Metropolitan Memphis Hotel & Lodging Association Scholarship (Wilson School)
This award(s) shall be given to students fulfilling the following criteria:
1. Recipients shall have declared a major in Hospitality and Resort Management.
2. Currently enrolled in the Hospitality and Resort Management program, (both undergraduate and graduate students are eligible for the
scholarship)
3. Good academic standing (typically higher than 2.5 GPA for undergraduate students and higher than 3.0 GPA for graduate students),
4. Have completed twelve (12) hours towards the major
5. Successful completion of the application as directed and providing all necessary documentation for consideration, including:
A copy of applicant’s resume
A letter from the student stating why they are deserving of the scholarship and why they are interested in a career in hospitality and
resort management
A letter of recommendation from an academic teacher
A verifiable minimum of 250 hours of relevant work experience or a favorable letter of reference from an employer. more...

Millercoors (Thurgood Marshall College Fund)
The Thurgood Marshall College Fund (TMCF), and MillerCoors are proud to offer financial assistance to outstanding students attending one of TMCF’s 47 publicly-supported Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) or a Predominantly Black Institutions (PBIs). 12 scholars will be selected to receive a scholarship up to $6,200 for 2020-2021 academic school year ($3,100 for each semester which can only be applied to verifiable costs associated with average tuition and usual fees).
Students must be 21 years of age or older by June 1, 2020.
Be enrolled full-time as a freshman, sophomore, junior or senior at a TMCF member-school during the 2020-2021 academic school year.
For Incoming Freshman – Provide proof of acceptance into or enrollment at a TMCF member-schools as an incoming freshman during the 2020-2021 academic school year.
Current cumulative grade point average of 3.0 or higher.
Able to demonstrate leadership abilities.
Able to demonstrate a financial need.
Be a U.S. Citizen or legal permanent resident with a valid permanent resident card or passport stamped I-551. more...

President Ambassador Scholarship - Dnu
The President’s Ambassador Program is the result of the Office of Admissions’ efforts to utilize the best voice of the campus – its students – in getting the word out about the campus and its resources. Ambassadors will represent the President, the college, the student body, and the Vol State individual programs. This program provides a full scholarship at Vol State for the 2021-2022 Academic Year and includes a $300 book stipend.
An Ambassador is a motivated and caring student who has a desire to work with faculty, staff, students, and members of the community. They will assist with campus tours, special events, speaking engagements, phone-a-thons, and community service.
While serving in the President’s Ambassador Scholarship program, students are able to:
- Expand their communication skills
- Enhance leadership skills
- Work collectively as a team member with peers
- Cultivate dynamic relationships
Applicants must have earned at least 12 credits at Vol State with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 in order to be eligible for consideration.
Application deadline is April 4, 2021. Ambassadors are selected through an interview process. All applicants will be contacted about the first-round interviews in April. more...

The President's Scholarship is available to full - time freshmen attending Johnson University. Selection for this award is based on a combination of ACT / SAT scores and cumulative high school grade point averages. more...

Presser (Rudi E. Scheidt School Of Music) (Inactive)
1. Majoring in Music.
2. To be awarded for year following the end of the student’s junior year, to be paid at beginning of senior year.
3. Recipient shall not confine studies exclusively to music.
4. Selected by the head of the Music Department. more...

Professional Attire Grant
Eligible Students:
Are currently an undergraduate student enrolled at the University of Memphis with a minimum of six (6) credit hours.
Are Pell‐eligible and/or have a demonstrated financial need (demonstrated financial need includes students who are Pell grant‐eligible or who are experiencing a financial hardship that would present a significant challenge in obtaining appropriate professional attire).
Have a profile in TigerLink powered by Handshake completed at 100%
Plan to participate in upcoming career fairs, job interviews, internship opportunities, or other professional events.
Submit a brief response to the two following supplemental questions below to careerservices@memphis.edu with the subject line: Professional Attire Grant more...
