Robert W. Yates Choral Music Scholarship (Rudi E. Scheidt School Of Music)
This award(s) shall be given to
1. Undergraduate students who are members of a Choral Ensemble at the University of Memphis and
2. Shall be nominated by the Director of such group with the appropriate approval of the Director of the School of Music and Dean
3. For the purpose of providing travel assistance to qualifying students for trips more than three days in length and for expenses not otherwise covered by the University of Memphis.
4. Recipients must be in good academic standing with a minimum GPA of 2.00 and maintain good standing as a member of a University of Memphis Choral Ensemble.
5. Students with demonstrated financial need as demonstrated by FAFSA will be given preference.
6. Funds are to be disbursed half for the fall semester and half for the spring, unless the recipient is graduating in the fall, in which case the full award may be disbursed for fall semester. (Student must have applied for graduation and be reflected in Banner as such).
From the donor as to why this scholarship exists. “I have always been interested and involved in must most of my life. During my time in college at Arkansas State, I participated in various choral music groups. After completing graduate school at the UofM in 1968, I worked in the UofM Undergraduate Admissions Office until retirement in 1997. During that time, I traveled with various music ensembles on recruiting trips. I was with the University Singers when they performed at the World’s Fair in New Orleans and at Carnegie Hall.
Because of my travels with the Singers, I became aware that there were members of the group from time to time who could not participate because of financial and/or work restrictions. Since my experience in college music programs were so meaningful to me, I didn’t want a lack of means to keep others from this same enjoyment. This is what primarily precipitated my interest in establishing the scholarship”. more...

Roberta M. Bobbie Yates Scholarship
Scholarship for outstanding, full-time incoming freshmen enrolling at the University of Tennessee-Chattanooga who are accepted into the schools Honors Program. Selection based on excellence in academic achievement, ACT/SAT scores, financial need, leadership, and service. Eligible students must submit a completed Application for Admission & Scholarship (AAS). Application is made directly to the Brock Scholars Program, University Honors Program. Award amount covers tuition, fees, books, and partial campus housing. Renwable. more...

Roberto Jimenez Scholarship

Robertson County Career Women's Club Scholarship
The Robertson County Career Women’s Club Scholarship is an annual, need-based scholarship for a female, non-traditional student attending the VSCC Highland Crest campus. Eligible applicant should be a resident of Robertson county and maintain a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5. Recipients may be full-time (12 credit hours) or part-time (6 credit hours). more...

Scholarship For Disadvantaged Students
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Tennessee State University College of Health Sciences majoring in Dental Hygiene, Medical Technology, Occupational Therapy, or Speech Pathology and Audiology. Students must be lawful permanent residents of the U.S., Puerto Rico, Northern Mariana Islands, Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, or Trust Territory of the Pacific. Applicants must have a GPA between 2.3 and 2.9, a 19 ACT score or less, a D average on 6 or less major courses, be former HCOP participants, reside in rural/underserved areas, and have had economic or environmental disadvantages. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Suntrust John W. Boyd Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to students pursuing degrees that lead to careers in farming and agribusiness programs. Must be a member of the underrepresented and economically disenfranchised population., with a minimum cumulative 2.7 GPA at the time of application and maintain at least a 2.8 on a semester and cumulative basis while receiving the scholarship. Scholarship recipients must enroll in at least and maintain 15 credit hours for fall and spring semesters, upload an updated current resume, a letter of recommendation from a High School Counselor, and a letter of recommendation from a High School Teacher. The recipient must submit a 500-800 word essay describing the applicant’s interest and intent to pursue a career in agribusiness or the food and agricultural science. For new incoming freshmen only, more...

Tcmf/Kellog Company Fund Scholarship
The Thurgood Marshall College Fund is pleased to partner with the Kellogg Company Fund to provide financial assistance to outstanding students attending one of the 47 publicly-supported Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) within the TMCF member-school network. Selected scholars will receive a one-year merit scholarship of up to $7,000 to cover the costs of tuition and fees, on-campus room and board and textbooks purchased from member-schools more...

The Thurgood Marshall College Fund and Wyndham Worldwide are proud to provide financial assistance to outstanding students attending one of the 47 publicly-supported Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) within the TMCF member-school network. Selected scholars will receive a one-year scholarship at up to $7,000 used to cover the costs of tuition and fees, on-campus room and board and textbooks. more...

Students family adjusted gross income (AGC) must be $27,000 or less. A FAFSA must be submitted by March 1st. Award amount is for full tuition. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Tennessee Scholars Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen or transfer students enrolled full-time at the University of Tennessee-Knoxville. Students must have a minimum 3.7 GPA, a minimum 29 ACT score or a 1280 to 1310 SAT score, demonstrate community service, leadership skills, and participation in extracurricular activities. Tennessee Scholars Scholarship
The Tennessee Scholars Scholarship is open to graduating high school seniors and transfer students who plan on enrolling at the University of Tennessee. You must have at least a 3.7 GPA and a minimum 29 ACT or 1280 SAT. Your selection will be based on merit, extracurricular/community activities and creativity. more...

Tennessee State University Academic Higher Achiever Scholarship
The Academic Higher Achiever Scholarship recognizes incoming freshman whose academic accomplishments and involvements indicate promise for becoming outstanding and engaged student learners at Tennessee State University. To be considered for this scholarship a student must be a high school graduate from the state of Tennessee with a minimum 3.0 unweighted high school gpa and a 21 ACT or 980 SAT (Verbal and Math); and no prior college attendance. If awarded the scholarship covers Tuition and Fees, Room and Board up to cost of attendance for eight continuous semesters. more...

Tennessee State University Academic Work
The TSU Academic Work Scholarship recognizes incoming freshman whose academic accomplishments and involvements indicate promise for becoming outstanding and engaged student learners at Tennessee State University. To be considered for this scholarship a student must be a high school graduate from the state of Tennessee with a minimum 2.9 unweighted High School GPA and a 19 ACT or 900 SAT (Verbal and Math); and no prior college attendance. If awarded the scholarship covers Tuition and Fees for eight continuous semesters .
Students awarded this scholarship must work 75 service hours a semester. more...

Tennessee State University Academic Work Scholarship
The TSU Academic Work Scholarship is awarded to recognize the academic achievements of incoming freshman residing in the State of Tennessee. To be considered for this scholarship a student must be a State of Tennessee high school graduate with a minimum 2.9 unweighted High School GPA and a 19 ACT or 900 SAT (Verbal and Math) test score; and no prior college attendance. If awarded the scholarship covers Tuition and Fees for up to eight semesters. more...

Tennessee State University Building Bridges Grant
The TSU Building Bridges Grant recognizes incoming freshman whose academic accomplishments and involvements indicate promise for becoming outstanding and engaged student learners at Tennessee State University. To be considered for this scholarship a student must graduate high school graduate with a minimum 3.0 unweighted High School GPA and a 21 ACT or 980 SAT (Verbal and Math) test score; with no prior college attendance. If awarded the scholarship covers Tuition, Fees, Room and Board for up to eight semesters. more...

The Breakfast Club Hbcu Scholarship
The Thurgood Marshall College Fund (TMCF), and iHeartMedia’s The Breakfast Club are proud to offer financial assistance to outstanding students attending Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) or a Predominantly Black Institutions (PBIs). Eighty-two scholars will be selected to receive a scholarship up to $5,000 for the 2020-2021 academic school year ($2,500 for each semester, which can only be applied to verifiable costs associated with average tuition and usual fees).
Be enrolled full-time as a freshman, sophomore, junior or senior during the 2020-2021 academic school year.
For Incoming Freshman – Provide proof of acceptance into or enrollment at as incoming freshman during the 2020-2021 academic school year.
Current cumulative grade point average of 3.0 or higher.
Able to demonstrate leadership abilities.
Able to demonstrate a financial need.
Be a U.S. Citizen or legal permanent resident with a valid permanent resident card or passport stamped I-551. more...

The Community Foundation
The Community Foundation of Middle Tennessee has served as a leader in philanthropy for more than 25 years, bringing good people and good causes together in 43 counties in Middle Tennessee and Kentucky. Our donors come from every corner of the community to achieve their charitable goals and impact a broad range of needs. We ensure the excellent stewardship of lasting charitable funds and support nonprofits that are doing great work that matters for their communities.
The Community Foundation of Middle Tennessee works with people who have great hearts, whether or not they have great wealth, to craft solutions that reflect their intentions and goals. more...

The Community Foundation Of Middle Tennessee
Thanks to the generosity of our donors dedicated to investing in students’ futures, we administer more than 100 scholarship funds through an open application process. Some scholarships help students from a particular school or area; others provide financial assistance to those pursuing a specific field of study; still others assist students most in need.
- more...

The Lewis H. And Dorothy P. Jones Endowed Scholarship
The Lewis H. and Dorothy P. Jones Endowed Scholarship is awarded to one full-time student majoring in Education and one full-time student majoring in Business; each student must be an enrolled freshman, sophomore, junior or senior at Tennessee State and in good standing. The student must be born in the State of TN, be a graduate of a TN high school, be a first generation college student, and show a need for financial assistance. The Luther C. Mcclellan Alumni Chapter Scholarship (Alumni Association)
Luther C. McClellan was one of the Memphis State Eight who were the first African-American students admitted to Memphis State University in 1959. Mr. Luther C. McClellan became the first African-American to graduate from The University of Memphis in 1962, earning a Bachelor of Science degree in Mathematics.
The Luther C. McClellan Alumni Chapter was established in May 1987 to encourage African-American alumni of The University of Memphis to participate in the activities of the National Alumni Association. The Luther C. McClellan scholarship was established in 1988 to assist deserving students at The University of Memphis.
The Luther C. McClellan Chapter of The University of Memphis Alumni Association will award the Luther C. McClellan Scholarship to a graduate and undergraduate minority student attending The University of Memphis. The purpose of this award is to recognize students who have shown outstanding academic achievement, leadership qualities and community involvement. Each student who receives a scholarship will receive an award in the amount of $500 for the school year. The winners will also receive certificates acknowledging their selection.
Interested candidates must be full-time students at The University of Memphis. Transfer students are eligible for this award as long as they meet all the other criteria. The undergraduate applicant must possess a minimum cumulative grade point average of 2.5 while the graduate applicant must possess a minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0 on the 4.0 scale. Each candidate must also submit one letter of recommendation from an advisor or University of Memphis faculty/staff member. more...

The Mike Meeks Endowed Scholarship Fund (Wilson School)
1. Recipients must be enrolled in the Kemmons Wilson School of Hospitality and Resort Management.
2. Shall have a minimum 2.5 GPA.
3. Shall have demonstrated financial need as determined after reviewing the completed Free Application for Federal Student Aid form. more...

In order to be eligible, students must have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.75 and demonstrate financial need as determined after review of the student’s completed Free Application for Federal Aid (FAFSA) form. Preference shall be given to member(s) of national engineering student organizations and to student(s) who are actively involved in, and giving back to, their communities. more...

Thurgood Marshall College Fund
The awards process is highly competitive and is given to outstanding and qualified students who plan to earn a baccalaureate, graduate or law degree from an accredited college or university. The average award is $3,100 per student per semester. Most scholarships are one year, non-renewable unless otherwise indicated and awards are given without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, disability or national origin. more...

Thurgood Marshall College Fund
TMCF offers three types of unique scholarships that are merit, plus need-based designed to address the financial needs of students attending a TMCF member-school or other accredited college or university (if applicable). The awards process is highly competitive and is given to outstanding and qualified students who plan to earn a baccalaureate, graduate or law degree. The average award is $3,100 per student per semester. Most scholarships are one year, non-renewable unless otherwise indicated. Awards are given without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, disability or national origin. more...

Tmcf
The Thurgood Marshall College Fund (TMCF), and Ford Motor Company Fund are proud to offer financial assistance to outstanding African American male students attending one of TMCF’s 47 publicly-supported Historically Black College and Universities (HBCUs) or a Predominantly Black Institution (PBI). Seven scholars will be selected to receive a scholarship of up to $6,200 for 2020-2021 academic school year ($3,100 per semester) which can only be applied to verifiable costs associated with average tuition and usual fees.
Eligibility Requirements
African American male, graduating high school senior, during the 2019-2020 academic school year
Be enrolled full-time as a freshman, sophomore, junior or senior at a TMCF member-school during the 2020-2021 academic school year
Current cumulative grade point average of 3.0 or higher
Able to demonstrate leadership abilities
Be a U.S. Citizen or legal permanent resident with valid permanent resident card or passport stamped I-551
For an Incoming Freshman – Provide proof of acceptance into or enrollment at a TMCF member-school as an incoming freshman during the 2020-2021 academic School year more...

Tscholars Project
The Tom Joyner Foundation and Tyson Foods, Inc. will work together to initiate the 2014 TScholars Project. The scholarship and internship arrangement with four historically black colleges/universities which were targeted by Tyson Foods, Inc. because of their proximity to Tyson company facilities and the availability of students majoring in Agriculture and Business.
To apply, students must complete the password-protected online application and provide all requested information. A biography and photo will be required if selected.

Uncf Homepage Log On Help American Honda Foundation Scholarship 2019
The American Honda Foundation Scholarship is directed to male students, who are classified as undergraduates at any accredited four-year colleges or universities within the United States. All of the candidates must be enrolled in one of the targeted fields of STEM and have permanent residency within the city of Los Angeles or Southern California. The candidates, who reside within the targeted regions of Los Angeles, California, will have a preference. The preferred areas of Los Angeles include the following: Carson, Compton, Harbor City, Long Beach, Lynwood, Watts, Willowbrook and Wilmington. In addition, candidates can also reside with remaining areas of Los Angeles and the entire Southern region of California. The selected recipients will be awarded during the 2019-20 year. more...

Uncf Scholarships
UNCF has helped more than 500,000 students earn their college degrees since its founding.
UNCF is the nation’s largest private scholarship provider to minority group members. Each year, we award more than $100 million in scholarships to students attending more than 1,100 schools across the country, including our prestigious network of 37 HBCUs. more...

United States Steel Foundation Honor Scholarships
Scholarship for freshmen and sophomores accepted to Vanderbilt University. Selection is based on academic merit, leadership, ACT/SAT scores, an essay, financial need, and recommendations. Preference given to dependents of United States Steel Corporation employees and retirees. Students need only to complete the admissions application to be considered for this award. Number of awards may vary. Award amount usually is for partial tuition, but may cover up to full-tuition. Renewable. more...

Usda 1890 National Scholars Program
The USDA/1890 National Scholars Program is a partnership between of the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) and the 1890 Historically Black Land-Grant Universities. The USDA/1890 National Scholars Program is implemented under the USDA Fellows Experience Program (FEP). Scholars accepted into the program will be appointed using the Schedule A® authority (5 CFR 213.3202) and are not eligible for noncompetitive conversion to full time employment upon graduation.
However, all USDA/1890 National Scholars are required to compete for appropriate employment immediately after graduation and, if selected, commit to at least one year of service to USDA for each year of financial assistance provided. (Note: Specific details of this service requirement will be outlined in the service agreement entered into by the selected Scholar, the University at which the Scholar is matriculated, and the USDA Sponsoring Agency.)
The USDA/1890 National Scholars Program will provide full tuition, employment, employee benefits, fees, books, and room and board each year for up to 4 years to selected students pursuing a bachelor’s degree at the following universities:
Tennessee State University more...

Vivian Bolton Scholarship

It was established by Mrs Ellen Wemyss in memory of her husband Will H Wemyss. The minimum cumulative GPA to maintain the scholarship is a 3.0. more...

Students must be nominated by a high school counselor, teacher, principal, minister of the Presbyterian Church, or by alumni and friends of the College. Award amount is full tuition, fees, and room and board. Renewable. more...

Preference is for descendants of graduates of the Old Wilson County High School and students who are majoring in the social work or a related field. Students must be US citizens and have minimum cumulative GPA of 2.8. Applicants must submit a essay on examples of Perseverance. more...

1. Student(s) must show leadership and excellence while performing their duties in the marching band.

Wells & Associates, Pllc Scholarship (Cecil C. Humphreys School Of Law)
This award(s) shall be given to an incoming student enrolled in the Cecil C. Humphreys School of Law and who:
1. Exemplifies academic merit
2. Helps the school remain competitive with enrollment, including with respect to the diversity of its students
3. Demonstrates an interest in litigation following law school.
4. In addition, the recipient will be offered a summer intern position with Horne & Wells, PLLC for the summer following the awarding of the scholarship. more...

This award shall be used for the following purpose:
1. The recipients of this award shall be the student selected as the “best oral advocate” by the Judges for the 1L Moot Court Competition.
2. This scholarship will be given in the fall semester of each year, and
3. Should the recipient not return for that semester, then the scholarship will not be awarded for that year. more...
